clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of a Resiliency Intervention for Siblings of Children With Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD)
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of a Resiliency Intervention for Siblings of Children With Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD)

brief_summary.textblock:
The proposed research has the following objectives:
Specific Aim 1 (Phase II): Based off findings from the "Development of a Resiliency Program for Siblings of Children with Autism Spectrum Disorder" qualitative focus group study (protocol 2019P002284), the aim is to determine the feasibility, acceptability, and preliminary efficacy of an 8-session Relaxation Response Resiliency (SibChat) program for siblings of children with ASD.
Primary Aim 2 (Phase III): To test the effectiveness of a pilot waitlist controlled trial on improving resiliency, and on improving stress coping, distress, growth enhancement, positive and adaptive emotions, anxiety and depression, worry, and sleep. This will be assessed by comparing Baseline-3 mo. scores on primary and secondary outcome measures between the Immediate and Waitlist control groups.
Secondary Aims: Among participants randomized to both conditions, to investigate the extent of pre-post changes in primary and secondary outcomes.
Secondary Aim 2: Among immediate condition group only, to assess whether end-of-treatment (3 mo. post enrollment) improvements will be sustained at 6-mo. post enrollment.

detailed_description.textblock: This intervention will be a modified version of Dr. Elyse Park's evidence-based 8-week multimodal treatment which is designed to promote adaptation to stress and promotion of resiliency. The program is an 8 session, 1 hour a week multi modal intervention that incorporates relaxation techniques, stress awareness discussion, and adaptive strategies for coping with stress. This study will refine an 8-session group virtual-delivered resiliency treatment program consisting of 8 virtual group 1-1 Â½ hour sessions. The goal of this study would be to advance our ultimate objective to implement a national sibling resiliency program.

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility assessed by the number SibChat-3RP of sessions attended
primary_outcome.description: Number of sessions attended recorded out of 8 total program sessions.

primary_outcome.measure: Acceptability assessed using the Participant Feedback Survey
primary_outcome.description: The participant feedback survey is a questionnaire made up of likert scales and open ended questions designed to record acceptability of the SibChat-3RP program as indicated by the participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness of trial on improving resiliency (assessed using Current Experiences Scale)
primary_outcome.description: Current experiences Scale is a questionnaire. Improved resiliency is measured base upon change in questionnaire score.

primary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness of trial on improving stress coping ability (assessed using Measure of Current Status-A)
primary_outcome.description: Measure of Current Status-A is a questionnaire - the score on the questionnaire is used to indicate stress coping ability. A change in score indicates a change in indicated stress coping ability.

primary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness of trial on improving stress coping (assessed using KIDCOPE, adolescent version)
primary_outcome.description: KIDCOPE, adolescent version is a questionnaire - the score on questionnaire is used to indicate stress coping ability in adolescents. A change in score indicates a change in indicated stress coping ability.

primary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness of trial on improving distress (assessed by Visual Analogue 0-10 Scale)
primary_outcome.description: The Visual Analogue 0-10 scale is a questionnaire - the score (out of 10) on the questionnaire is used to indicate level of distress. A change in score indicates a change in indicated distress.

primary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness of trial on improving growth enhancement (assessed by Cognitive and Affective Mindfulness Scale)
primary_outcome.description: Cognitive and Affective Mindfulness Scale is a questionnaire - the score on the questionnaire is used to indicate level of growth enhancement. A change in score indicates a change in indicated growth enhancement.

primary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness of trial on improving positive and adaptive emotions (assessed by by the Positive and Negative Affect Schedule for Children)
primary_outcome.description: Positive and Negative Affect Schedule for Children is a questionnaire - the score on the questionnaire is used to indicate level of positive and adaptive emotions. A change in score indicates a change in indicated positive and adaptive emotions.

primary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness of trial on improving anxiety, depression, and sleep (as measured by the Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System Anxiety, Depression, and Sleep Short Form))
primary_outcome.description: The Patient-Reported Outcome Measurement Information System Anxiety and Depression Short Form are questionnaires - the score on all of the questionnaires uses the same unit of meausre and is used to indicate level of anxiety and depression and sleep. A change in score indicates a change in indicated anxiety and depression and sleep.

primary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness of trial on improving worry (as measured by the Penn State Worry Questionnaire Short Form)
primary_outcome.description: Penn State Worry Questionnaire Short Form is a questionnaire - the score on the questionnaire is used to indicate level of worry. A change in score indicates a change in indicated worry.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pre-post intervention changes as measured by change in primary outcome scores.
secondary_outcome.description: Among participants randomized to both conditions, pre-post intervention changes in primary outcome scores will be assessed using the scores from the questionnaire (includes all primary outcome scores indicated above).

secondary_outcome.measure: Sustained improvements in primary outcomes as measured by sustained change in primary outcome scores.
secondary_outcome.description: Among immediate condition group only, assess whether end-of-treatment (3 mo. post enrollment) improvements in primary outcome scores (indicated above; collected using a questionnaire) will be sustained at 6-mo. post enrollment.

arm_group.description: An adapted version of the Relaxation Response Resiliency Program (3RP) for siblings of children with ASD. The adapted program incorporates the three prongs of the 3RP: RR elicitation, stress awareness, and adaptive strategies.

intervention.intervention_name: Relaxation Response Resiliency Program for Siblings of Children with ASD
intervention.description: Virtually delivered psycho-educational resiliency training program for teenage siblings of children with ASD.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age 14-17 years (inclusive of ages 14 and 17)
2. Being the sibling of at least one individual with ASD
3. Access to internet or smart phone
4. English speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Diagnosis of ASD
2. Past year psychiatric hospitalization
There are no exclusion criteria with respect to ethnicity or socioeconomic status.
